Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Initial Appearance as to Gregorio Cardenas-Marquez, Angel David Rosa-Martinez, Miguel A. Lozada-Rivas, Ada Rosa Garcia-Jimenez, Sylvia Cardenas-Marquez, Ana L. Medina-Casanova, Felix M. Lopez-Falu, Aida Rivera-Jimenez, Adalberto Lebron- Rodriguez, Tomas Diaz-Martinez, Yairy Munoz-Estrella, Richard Rosario-Valentin, Jose Rodriguez-Escudero held on 3/5/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata. Defendants were provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23 forms filled by defendants, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendants will be represented by CJA counsel. Defendants ordered temporarily detained pending hearings. Arraignment/Detention set for 3/11/2013 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. USPTO Alexandra Estrada. (amr) (Entered: 03/05/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Initial Appearance as to Miguel Pena-Ramos held on 3/7/2013. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Jose Eliel Febres-Rivera (3) was held on 3/21/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty Peter Diaz. Deft was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a PONG as to all applicable counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Francisco A. Besosa for trial setting. The govt moved for detention. Defense counsel was heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amouunt of $100,000.00 of which $50,000.00 shall be secured by the deft's mother's house (if the equity of the house falls short then, and only then, will a bonding company be allowed). The remaining balance shall be unsecured. Standard conditions of release to include home detention w/electronic monitoring and drug testing/drug treatment as may be deemed necessary by PTS. Deft shall not reside at or visit, for any reason, the Dr. Lopez Sicardo Public Housing Project. Release order to issue once the secured portion of the bail has been posted and PTS has verified that a landline telephone is installed within deft's residence. (Court Reporter FTR, Interpreter Cristina Arsuaga) (Hearing was set for 1:30 p.m., held at 2:22-2:38 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 03/25/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Case called for change of plea hearing as to Pedro Diaz-Colon(6) and Alfred Valcarcel-Colon (12) on 9/12/2013, but not held. Present were: AUSA Teresa Zapata and Atty. Joseph Boucher (arrived at 10:10 am).* Defendant Diaz-Colon was present and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Mr. Boucher requested a brief continuance of both hearings because due to a misunderstanding of his part, defendant Valcarcel-Colon was not present in Court and because the plea agreements of both defendants have to be edited to include an additional wording to which the Government and defense counsel had previously agreed. ORDER re 1052 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 SENTENCE as to Feliciano Cruz-Rivera (2): DENIED. Defendant Cruz-Rivera was a drug point owner who carried firearms to protect the drug point, the drugs and the proceeds obtained from the sale of the drugs. As a drug point owner he would supervise drug trafficking activities at the drug point at the Lopez-Sicardo PHP and would obtain wholesale amounts of narcotics which would be prepared for street-level distribution by other members of the DTO. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 12/08/2014. (bre) (Entered: 12/08/2014)

ORDER re 1045 Motion to Reduce Sentence - USSC Amendment 782 as to Jose Eliel Febres-Rivera (3): GRANTED. Having reviewed the government's opposition to defendant's request to reduce his sentence, (Docket No. 1113), defendant's subsequent disagreement with the government's opposition, (Docket No. 1122), and the entire record, the Court orders that defendant Febres-Rivera's sentence be reduced from 121 to 120 months. The Court is flabbergasted and quite upset by the government's position in this case, involving a reduction of sentence of one month. A copy of this order shall be provided to FAUSA Timothy Henwood and U.S. Attorney Rodriguez- Velez. The Clerk will enter a sentence reduction order. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 03/09/2015. (bre) (Entered: 03/09/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Bail as to Edgardo Jose Sanchez-Martir (5) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 7/13/2015. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Mr. Allan Rivera substituting for Mr. Luis Rivera-Rodriguez. Defendant was present and under custody. He was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Besosa for scheduling. As to bail, the Government requested detention and proffered evidence against defendant. Mr. Rivera requested bail, agreeing with the recommendation of the PT report, but offered nothing to rebut the presumption. After hearing both parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:13.Hearing ended at 02:17.Interpreter -Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 07/14/2015)

Defense counsel filed a waiver of preliminary hearing. The Court, after advising the defendant as to his rights, accepted the waiver and made a finding of probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motion filed by the probation officer. AFPD requested that the defendant be allowed to be released to Guarabi for drug treatment. AUSA argued against defendant's release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Roberto Medina-Rivera (24) held on 4/1/2019. Present were AUSA Marie Christina Amy and AFPD Alejandra Bird, as well as USPO Jose Luis Lozada. Defendant was present and under custody. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed and approved. Probable cause found as to the allegations included in docket 1347 and the case was referred to Judge Besosa for the full hearing. AFPD Bird stated that although they were accepting the allegations included in the motion filed, none of them were related with new criminal conduct. She also requested that defendant be allowed to receive inpatient treatment at Guarabi while waiting for the final hearing. The Government, after speaking with USPO Lozada, did not oppose the request. The Court granted the request and ordered that the USM bring defendant tomorrow so that he can be released to Guarabi personnel. The Court also advised defendant to faithfully comply with all the conditions imposed at Guarabi for his own benefit. AFPD Bird made reference to the motion filed asking for disclosure of evidence. The Court informed that since the same has not been referred, it cannot rule on it. (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 11:35.Hearing ended at 11:41.Interpreter -Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) (Entered: 04/01/2019)

Defendant is present in court and is being assisted by a certified court interpreter. AFPD Ivan Santos is also present in court. Copy of Dkt. 1371 was provided to the defendant. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether the supervised release conditions had been violated. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filled by defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender is ordered to represent the defendant. Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 7/23/2019 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. Defense counsel requested that the defendant be allowed to continue residing at residential program instead of being detained at MDC Guaynabo seeing as the allegations in USPO motion stem from dates prior to defendant's placement at Guara-Bi. ORDER re 1438 Motion Requesting Order as to Roberto Medina-Rivera (24): DENIED. As first indicated by the Court when it denied defendant's first motion for immediate sentence, the probation officer does not recommend the sentence recommended by the parties (docket numbers 1432 and 1433), the lower end of the 3 to 9-month guideline sentence. Secondly, the COVOD-19 situation, by itself, is not a reason for the Court to agree to any sentence. Thirdly, as has been indicated by several district and magistrate judges, there are no inmates infected by the COVID-19 virus in any BOP institutions in Puerto Rico, and the risk of infection has been minimized by the appropriate protocols which have been established by the BOP. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 05/11/2020. (bre) (Entered: 05/11/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Roberto Medina-Rivera (24) held via videoconference on 7/1/2020. Present: AUSA Michelle Colon and AFPD Samantha Drake. Defendant U/C was assisted by the certified court interpreter. USPO D. Reyes also present. All parties connected remotely. The defendant waived his right to appear physically for his revocation hearing and agreed to proceed via VTC. Arguments for mitigation of punishment and defendant's allocution were heard. ORDER re 1506 Motion for Early Termination of Probation as to Aida Rivera-Jimenez (26): DENIED without prejudice. The probation officer has not shown any "special, extraordinary, or unforeseen circumstances" that warrant early termination of the defendant's supervised release term. "Early termination is not warranted where a defendant did nothing more than what [s]he is required to do by law." Whittingham v. United States, 2017 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 77454 at *18-19 (S.D.N.Y. May 22, 2017). If and when the probation officer can show special, extraordinary, or unforeseen reasons, and not just boiler-plate reasons, the Court may reconsider his request. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 03/12/2021. (bre) (Entered: 03/12/2021)
